data.title: A New Attraction at the Arboretum
data.text: Visiting the Des Moines Arboretum is a treat in itself, but now you can experience a California-like atmosphere in this bright and airy restaurant within sight of some of your favorite plants.

data.title: Very nice Restaurant
data.text:
I went there for lunch, The soup of the day was pumpkin and sweet potato bisque was so good. Also had the salmon salad which was very good too.
Lovely setting, also outdoor seating when weather permits

data.title: Wonderful garden setting for a relaxed, eclectic or light lunch
data.text: Check out Trellis within the Des Moines Botanical Garden (used to be Botanical Center) near downtown for a lovely setting for lunch.It reminds me of a European or New York museum lunch. You can order a full lunch option or two of any option. They have soups, salads, pastas and sandwiches. The items tend to be on the vegetarian, Mediterranean or more unusual side of luncheon options. They often have curry, spicy or gluten-free or vegan options.  You can have a sample of soup before you order. They have wines and beers to try. The view is of the gardens and on nice days, you can eat outside. It is a place you can come for lunch at 11 am and stay until 2 pm. It is ideal for groups, friends meeting for lunch or more relaxed business meetings. You do not have to pay for admissions; just tell the desk at the shop that you are going to Trellis and enter through the right hand door to go to the Trellis door rather than go through the Botanical dome. They are  not open on Mondays! I took my mother on a recent Tuesday and we tried the soups and the tomato salad to start. I had the grilled fruit and brie flatbread. She had the turkey sandwich. She could only eat one half. We each liked the potato and beet soup. The salad had too many pine nuts on it for me, but the tomatoes were nice. I loved the flatbread, but it was messy. Nice and fresh as always. They always have some interesting desserts, as well.

data.title: Relaxing and wonderful kunch
data.text: Just had s scrumptious lunch here.  The grilled fruit flatbread was a tasty and light sandwich.  The blue cheese and beef salad was also a neat blend of tastes.  Our party also tried two wines from their selection - excellent.  Craft beers are also available.  Neat atmosphere with creative menu.  Loved it!

data.title: Worth the trip
data.text: We were there on Mother's Day -- without a reservation -- and didn't expect to get a seat.  We checked with the hostess who said that there was an open table for two if we'd like it. Others were turned away so we felt very lucky.  The meal was great and we would recommend the restaurant to anyone.

data.title: Great lunch place with a beautiful view.
data.text: Had lunch with a friend there, looking for a patio on a beautiful day.  Food choices were very interesting and alluring.  One can choose a "small plate" on the entrees, which we did, and the amount of food was plenty!  Waitress was very attentive.  We stayed and chatted until after 2:30---with no pressure from the wait staff. The patio overlooks the new botanical gardens.  Very pleasant to see water lilies in the pond as we ate.

data.title: Visited After the Botanical Garden Tour
data.text: After spending a couple of hours walking though the botanical gardens (that was very relaxing and educational), we decided to grab a snack and beverage. The staff made suggestions on what to order (salads were good)  and we sampled two local beers on tap. This is a very nice part of the Botanical Gardens which adds to the pleasure of the visit. You can sit inside or outside on the patio.

data.title: Patio Lunch Can't be Beat
data.text: Have lunch on the patio, where the view of the nearby pond and its water lilies is so pleasant and relaxing.  The food is always good and nicely presented.  The menu changes on the first of each month.  Wait staff was friendly, but could use some seasoning.

data.title: Great venue, fair food, too hot inside
data.text:
Was at a party for about 32 people in a unique venue at the botanical garden. Wait staff was young and not to experienced. We had a choice between steaks and salmon and the steaks were served between medium rare and medium well with no attempt to see what the individuals wanted. With only 32 people steak cooking preference should have been achievable.

The real downer was the temperature in the room. Way to hot to be enjoyable.
I have to suggest eating there any month except June through August. No excuse for the room being that hot.

The venue inside the botanical garden could have an outstanding restaurant but until the staff gets more experience, the food is cooked to order and the air conditioner can handle summer in Des Moines, I can only give this three stars.

data.title: Very Enjoyable Restaurant
data.text: We love Trellis-fantastic location inside the Des Moines Conservatory! Food is great, imaginative, contemporary, filling, the service is always great.

data.title: Unique setting
data.text: You can eat here without paying admission to the Garden.  The food is delicious and somewhat unusual.  Nice drinks also.

data.title: Great lunch with a beautiful setting
data.text: Nestled into the botanical gardens is this jewel of a restaurant. The chef prepares a different menu each month using locally grown foods. We had two salads and they were both delicious. Our server, who turned out to be the chef's daughter, was great. The prices were very reasonable.

data.title: Garden atmosphere awesome food
data.text: The Trellis is an amazing little bistro within the confines of the Iowa Botonical Gardens! The food was excellent and dessert...well I have to put a few more extra hours in at the gym. Highly recommended if you need lunch in the downtown Des Moines district.

data.title: Favorite Lunch Place in DSM!
data.text: Lisa LaValle prepares healthy, inviting, delicious entrees consisting of soups, salads, and sandwiches.  They have about half dozen craft beers on tap along with a modest wine selection.  Menu changes with the seasons, always offering a great selection of new seasonal items.  I usually dine there at least twice a month, great wait staff and ambience.

data.title: Trellis is a wonderful place to go!
data.text: We had lunch there on an early Sunday morning in the spring and the view out the window was of the walking, biking trail, gardens of tulips, and warm, sunny weather. You can have lunch outside at the tables on the patio, or you can order inside from a wonderful menu that changes every month. The food is beautifully plated and tastes just as delicious as it looks! We always order soup, warm weather or not, because it is so tasty! We also do the "Pick Two" and then we can each try a little of each other's food! Dessert is special, too! Don't skip it! Service is top notch! Go visit the Botanical Center when you finish. What a wonderful way to end the meal! Can't wait to go again!

data.title: Consistent quality & service
data.text: This was my sixth trip to Trellis in the last six months.  As with each visit, I was greeted warmly by professional staff and offered a nice menu featuring a variety of delicious choices--big enough to always try something new and not so big it feels like one is reading a book.  My meal, as always, tasted fresh and well seasoned (but never over seasoned).  So long at Trellis puts out such good food coupled with professional service and the pleasant atmosphere of looking out on the water gardents, I will continue to return.

data.title: LOVE this restaurant - fine dining for lunch at a reasonable price
data.text:
The menu here is limited and changes every month.  It doesn't matter what you order, it will be fabulous.  Even if you don't like some of the ingredients listed on the menu, they will have put them together so masterfully that the result is fantastic.

Oh, and the soup.   So often we want to try many things.  So we "pick two" on the menu, and then take a bowl of soup home for lunch the next day.  The soup changes each month too, plus they often have a daily special.  You can even order a soup sampler.

They have an apple tea - a hot tea - that is so delicious.  I don't know how to describe it.  I don't like flavored teas much but this is just perfect and not sweet.  I think they serve it cold too.  It is a specialty.  In the winter we have tea with lunch.  Sometimes in the summer we indulge in a lovely glass of wine on the patio.

And the service:  Efficient, very friendly, helpful.

This is a bit of a gushing review!  But Trellis deserves it.

data.title: Excellent Lunch Restaurant in the Botanical Center
data.text:
This is a beautiful place to dine.  We recently visited when three chefs from France were visiting, so we enjoyed a special French lunch.  The food is excellent and service superb.

Lisa, the owner and chef, is onsite!

Unfortunately, this restaurant is open only of lunch. There is ample free parking.  

We are from Des Moines, and this is one of our favorites!

data.title: OK but mediocre service and long wait times...
data.text: The Trellis is located in the Des Moines Botanical Ctr. The menu offers soups, sandwiches and salads - nothing special. I wouldn't say the service or menu is anything special.

data.title: THE best place for lunch
data.text: I've had lunch hear often.  Great food.  The terrace is great on a sunny day with views of downtown.  Arrive by 11:30 if you want a table.
